headers.mt1: The Fifth Book of Moses, called Deuteronomy

verses.text:
These \add be\add* the words which Moses spake unto all Israel
on this side Jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against
the Red \add sea\add*, between Paran, and Tophel, and Laban, and
Hazeroth, and Dizahab.\f + \fr 1.1  \ft the Red…: or, Zuph\f*

(\add There are\add* eleven days’ \add journey\add* from Horeb
by the way of mount Seir unto Kadesh-barnea.)

And it came to pass in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month,
on the first \add day\add* of the month, \add that\add* Moses spake
unto the children of Israel, according unto all that the \nd LORD\nd*
had given him in commandment unto them;

After he had slain Sihon the king of the Amorites, which dwelt
in Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, which dwelt at Astaroth in
Edrei:

On this side Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare
this law, saying,

The \nd LORD\nd* our God spake unto us in Horeb, saying, Ye have
dwelt long enough in this mount:

Turn you, and take your journey, and go to the mount of the
Amorites, and unto all \add the places\add* nigh thereunto, in the
plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the
sea side, to the land of the Canaanites, and unto Lebanon, unto the
great river, the river Euphrates.\f + \fr 1.7  \ft all…: Heb. all his
neighbours\f*

Behold, I have set the land before you: go in and possess the
land which the \nd LORD\nd* sware unto your fathers, Abraham, Isaac,
and Jacob, to give unto them and to their seed after them.\f + \fr 1.8 
\ft set: Heb. given\f*

¶ And I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not able to
bear you myself alone:

The \nd LORD\nd* your God hath multiplied you, and, behold, ye
\add are\add* this day as the stars of heaven for multitude.

(The \nd LORD\nd* God of your fathers make you a thousand times
so many more as ye \add are\add*, and bless you, as he hath promised you!)

How can I myself alone bear your cumbrance, and your burden,
and your strife?

Take you wise men, and understanding, and known among your
tribes, and I will make them rulers over you.\f + \fr 1.13  \ft Take: Heb.
Give\f*

And ye answered me, and said, The thing which thou hast spoken
\add is\add* good \add for us\add* to do.

So I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and
made them heads over you, captains over thousands, and captains over
hundreds, and captains over fifties, and captains over tens, and
officers among your tribes.\f + \fr 1.15  \ft made: Heb. gave\f*

And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear \add the
causes\add* between your brethren, and judge righteously between
\add every\add* man and his brother, and the stranger \add that is\add* with him.

Ye shall not respect persons in judgment; \add but\add* ye shall
hear the small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the
face of man; for the judgment \add is\add* God’s: and the cause that is too
hard for you, bring \add it\add* unto me, and I will hear it.\f + \fr 1.17 
\ft respect…: Heb. acknowledge faces\f*

And I commanded you at that time all the things which ye should
do.

¶ And when we departed from Horeb, we went through all that
great and terrible wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain
of the Amorites, as the \nd LORD\nd* our God commanded us; and we
came to Kadesh-barnea.

And I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the
Amorites, which the \nd LORD\nd* our God doth give unto us.

Behold, the \nd LORD\nd* thy God hath set the land before
thee: go up \add and\add* possess \add it\add*, as the \nd LORD\nd*
God of thy fathers hath said unto thee; fear not, neither be discouraged.

¶ And ye came near unto me every one of you, and said, We will
send men before us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring
us word again by what way we must go up, and into what cities we shall
come.

And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you,
one of a tribe:

And they turned and went up into the mountain, and came unto the
valley of Eshcol, and searched it out.

And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and brought
\add it\add* down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, \add It
is\add* a good land which the \nd LORD\nd* our God doth give us.

Notwithstanding ye would not go up, but rebelled against the
commandment of the \nd LORD\nd* your God:

And ye murmured in your tents, and said, Because the \nd LORD\nd*
hated us, he hath brought us forth out of the land of Egypt, to deliver
us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.

Whither shall we go up? our brethren have discouraged our
heart, saying, The people \add is\add* greater and taller than we; the
cities \add are\add* great and walled up to heaven; and moreover we have
seen the sons of the Anakims there.\f + \fr 1.28  \ft discouraged: Heb.
melted\f*
Then I said unto you, Dread not, neither be afraid of them.

And in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that the \nd LORD\nd*
thy God bare thee, as a man doth bear his son, in all the way that ye
went, until ye came into this place.

Yet in this thing ye did not believe the \nd LORD\nd* your
God,

Who went in the way before you, to search you out a place
to pitch your tents \add in\add*, in fire by night, to shew you by what
way ye should go, and in a cloud by day.

And the \nd LORD\nd* heard the voice of your words, and was
wroth, and sware, saying,

Surely there shall not one of these men of this evil generation
see that good land, which I sware to give unto your fathers,

Save Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will I
give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to his children, because he hath
wholly followed the \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 1.36  \ft wholly…: Heb. fulfilled to go
after\f*

Also the \nd LORD\nd* was angry with me for your sakes, saying,
Thou also shalt not go in thither.

\add But\add* Joshua the son of Nun, which standeth before
thee, he shall go in thither: encourage him: for he shall cause Israel
to inherit it.

Moreover your little ones, which ye said should be a prey,
and your children, which in that day had no knowledge between good
and evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they shall
possess it.

But \add as for\add* you, turn you, and take your journey into the
wilderness by the way of the Red sea.

Then ye answered and said unto me, We have sinned against the
\nd LORD\nd*, we will go up and fight, according to all that the
\nd LORD\nd* our God commanded  us. And when ye had girded on every
man his weapons of war, ye were ready to go up into the hill.

And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Say unto them, Go not up,
neither fight; for I \add am\add* not among you; lest ye be smitten
before your enemies.

So I spake unto you; and ye would not hear, but rebelled against the
commandment of the \nd LORD\nd*, and went presumptuously up into the
hill.\f + \fr 1.43  \ft went…: Heb. ye were presumptuous, and went
up\f*

And the Amorites, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against
you, and chased you, as bees do, and destroyed you in Seir, \add even\add*
unto Hormah.

And ye returned and wept before the 
d LORD
d*; but the

d LORD
d* would not hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.

So ye abode in Kadesh many days, according unto the days that ye
abode \add there\add*.

Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the
way of the Red sea, as the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto me: and we compassed
mount Seir many days.
And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto me, saying,
Ye have compassed this mountain long enough: turn you northward.

And command thou the people, saying, Ye \add are\add* to pass
through the coast of your brethren the children of Esau, which dwell
in Seir; and they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves therefore:

Meddle not with them; for I will not give you of their land,
no, not so much as a foot breadth; because I have given mount Seir
unto Esau \add for\add* a possession.\f + \fr 2.5  \ft no…: Heb. even to the treading of the sole of the
foot\f*

Ye shall buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall also
buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.

For the \nd LORD\nd* thy God hath blessed thee in all the works
of thy hand: he knoweth thy walking through this great wilderness:
these forty years the \nd LORD\nd* thy God \add hath been\add* with thee; thou hast
lacked nothing.

And when we passed by from our brethren the children of Esau,
which dwelt in Seir, through the way of the plain from Elath, and from
Ezion-gaber, we turned and passed by the way of the wilderness of
Moab.

And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Distress not the Moabites,
neither contend with them in battle: for I will not give thee of their
land \add for\add* a possession; because I have given Ar unto the
children of Lot \add for\add* a possession.\f + \fr 2.9  \ft Distress…: or, Use no hostility against
Moab\f*

The Emims dwelt therein in times past, a people great, and
many, and tall, as the Anakims;

Which also were accounted giants, as the Anakims; but the
Moabites call them Emims.

The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children
of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before
them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his
possession, which the \nd LORD\nd* gave unto them.\f + \fr 2.12 
\ft succeeded: Heb. inherited\f*\f + \fr 2.12  \ft stead: or, room\f*

Now rise up, \add said I\add*, and get you over the brook
Zered. And we went over the brook Zered.\f + \fr 2.13  \ft brook: or,
valley\f*

And the space in which we came from Kadesh-barnea, until we were come
over the brook Zered, \add was\add* thirty and eight years; until all the
generation of the men of war were wasted out from among the host,
as the \nd LORD\nd* sware unto them.\f + \fr 2.14  \ft brook: or,
valley\f*

For indeed the hand of the \nd LORD\nd* was against them, to
destroy them from among the host, until they were consumed.

¶ So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consumed
and dead from among the people,
That the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto me, saying,

Thou art to pass over through Ar, the coast of Moab, this
day:

And \add when\add* thou comest nigh over against the children
of Ammon, distress  them not, nor meddle with them: for I will not
give thee of the land of the children of Ammon \add any\add* possession;
because I have given it unto the children of Lot \add for\add* a
possession.

(That also was accounted a land of giants: giants dwelt therein in old
time; and the Ammonites call them Zamzummims;\f + \fr 2.20  \ft Zamzummims: also called,
Zuzims\f*

A people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakims; but the
\nd LORD\nd* destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and
dwelt in their stead:

As he did to the children of Esau, which dwelt in Seir, when he
destroyed the Horims from before them; and they succeeded them, and
dwelt in their stead even unto this day:

And the Avims which dwelt in Hazerim, \add even\add* unto
Azzah, the Caphtorims, which came forth out of Caphtor, destroyed
them, and dwelt in their stead.)

¶ Rise ye up, take your journey, and pass over the river Arnon:
behold, I have given into thine hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon,
and his land: begin to possess \add it\add*, and contend with him in
battle.\f + \fr 2.24  \ft begin…: Heb. begin, possess\f*

This day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear
of thee upon the nations \add that are\add* under the whole heaven,
who shall hear report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish
because of thee.

¶ And I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth unto
Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,

Let me pass through thy land: I will go along by the high
way, I will neither turn unto the right hand nor to the left.

(As the children of Esau which dwell in Seir, and the Moabites
which dwell in Ar, did unto me;) until I shall pass over Jordan into the
land which the \nd LORD\nd* our God giveth us.

But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the
\nd LORD\nd* thy God hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate,
that he might deliver him into thy hand, as \add appeareth\add* this
day.

And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Behold, I have begun to
give Sihon and his land before thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest
inherit his land.

Then Sihon came out against us, he and all his people, to
fight at Jahaz.

And the \nd LORD\nd* our God delivered him before us; and we
smote him, and his sons, and all his people.

And we took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed
the men, and the women, and the little ones, of every city, we left
none to remain:\f + \fr 2.34  \ft the men…: Heb. every city of men, and women, and little
ones\f*

Only the cattle we took for a prey unto ourselves, and the
spoil of the cities which we took.

From Aroer, which \add is\add* by the brink of the river of
Arnon, and \add from\add* the city that \add is\add* by the river,
even unto Gilead, there was not one city too strong for us: the \nd LORD\nd*
our God delivered all unto us:

Only unto the land of the children of Ammon thou camest not,
\add nor\add* unto any place of the river Jabbok, nor unto the cities
in the mountains, nor unto whatsoever the \nd LORD\nd* our God forbad
 us.

Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan: and Og the king
of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at
Edrei.

And the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me, Fear him not: for I will
deliver him, and all his people, and his land, into thy hand; and thou shalt
do unto him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites, which
dwelt at Heshbon.

So the \nd LORD\nd* our God delivered into our hands Og also, the
king of Bashan, and all his people: and we smote him until none was
left to him remaining.

And we took all his cities at that time, there was not a city
which we took not from them, threescore cities, all the region of
Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

All these cities \add were\add* fenced with high walls, gates,
and bars; beside unwalled towns a great many.

And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of
Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every
city.

But all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a
prey to ourselves.

(\add Which\add* Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion; and the Amorites
call it Shenir;)

All the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan,
unto Salchah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

For only Og king of Bashan remained of the remnant of giants;
behold, his bedstead \add was\add* a bedstead of iron; \add is\add*
it not in Rabbath of the children of Ammon? nine cubits \add was\add*
the length thereof, and four cubits the breadth of it, after the
cubit of a man.

And this land, \add which\add* we possessed at that time,
from Aroer, which \add is\add* by the river Arnon, and half mount
Gilead, and the cities thereof, gave I unto the Reubenites and to the
Gadites.

And the rest of Gilead, and all Bashan, \add being\add* the
kingdom of Og, gave I unto the half tribe of Manasseh; all the region
of Argob, with all Bashan, which was called the land of giants.

Jair the son of Manasseh took all the country of Argob unto the
coasts of Geshuri and Maachathi; and called them after his own name,
Bashan-havoth-jair, unto this day.
And I gave Gilead unto Machir.

The plain also, and Jordan, and the coast \add thereof\add*,
from Chinnereth even unto the sea of the plain, \add even\add* the
salt sea, under Ashdoth-pisgah eastward.\f + \fr 3.17  \ft Ashdoth-pisgah: or, the springs of Pisgah, or, the
hill\f*

¶ And I commanded you at that time, saying, The \nd LORD\nd*
your God hath given you this land to possess it: ye shall pass over
armed before your brethren the children of Israel, all \add that
are\add* meet for the war.\f + \fr 3.18  \ft meet…: Heb. sons of
power\f*

Until the \nd LORD\nd* have given rest unto your brethren, as well as unto you, and
\add until\add* they also possess the land which the \nd LORD\nd*
your God hath given them beyond Jordan: and \add then\add* shall ye
return every man unto his possession, which I have given you.

¶ And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Thine eyes have
seen all that the \nd LORD\nd* your God hath done unto these two
kings: so shall the \nd LORD\nd* do unto all the kingdoms whither thou
passest.

Ye shall not fear them: for the \nd LORD\nd* your God he shall
fight for you.
And I besought the \nd LORD\nd* at that time, saying,

O Lord \nd GOD\nd*, thou hast begun to shew thy servant thy
greatness, and thy mighty hand: for what God \add is there\add* in
heaven or in earth, that can do according to thy works, and according to thy
might?

I pray thee, let me go over, and see the good land that \add is\add*
beyond Jordan, that goodly mountain, and Lebanon.

But the 
d LORD
d* was wroth with me for your sakes, and would not
hear me: and the 
d LORD
d* said unto me, Let it suffice thee;
speak no more unto me of this matter.

Get thee up into the top of Pisgah, and lift up thine eyes
westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold
\add it\add* with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over this Jordan.\f + \fr 3.27 
\ft Pisgah: or, the hill\f*

But charge Joshua, and encourage him, and strengthen him: for he shall go
over before this people, and he shall cause them to inherit the land
which thou shalt see.
So we abode in the valley over against Beth-peor.

Now therefore hearken, O Israel, unto the statutes and unto the
judgments, which I teach you, for to do \add them\add*, that ye may
live, and go in and possess the land which the \nd LORD\nd* God of your
fathers giveth you.

Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye
diminish \add ought\add* from it, that ye may keep the commandments
of the \nd LORD\nd* your God which I command you.

Your eyes have seen what the 
d LORD
d* did because of Baal-peor:
for all the men that followed Baal-peor, the 
d LORD
d* thy God
hath destroyed them from among you.

But ye that did cleave unto the \nd LORD\nd* your God \add are\add*
alive every one of you this day.

Behold, I have taught you statutes and judgments, even as the
\nd LORD\nd* my God commanded  me, that ye should do so in the land
whither ye go to possess it.

Keep therefore and do \add them;\add* for this \add is\add*
your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the nations, which shall
hear all these statutes, and say, Surely this great nation \add is\add*
a wise and understanding people.

For what nation \add is there so\add* great, who \add hath\add*
God \add so\add* nigh unto them, as the \nd LORD\nd* our God \add is\add* in all
\add things that\add* we call upon him \add for\add*?

And what nation \add is there so\add* great, that hath statutes
and judgments \add so\add* righteous as all this law, which I set
before you this day?

\add Specially\add* the day that thou stoodest before the
\nd LORD\nd* thy God in Horeb, when the \nd LORD\nd* said unto me,
Gather me the people together, and I will make them hear my words,
that they may learn to fear me all the days that they shall live
upon the earth, and \add that\add* they may teach their children.

And ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain
burned with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds,
and thick darkness.\f + \fr 4.11  \ft midst: Heb. heart\f*

And the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto you out of the midst of the
fire: ye heard the voice of the words, but saw no similitude; only
\add ye heard\add* a voice.\f + \fr 4.12  \ft only…: Heb. save a
voice\f*

And he declared unto you his covenant, which he commanded
you to perform, \add even\add* ten commandments; and he wrote them upon
two tables of stone.

¶ And the \nd LORD\nd* commanded  me at that time to teach
you statutes and judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go
over to possess it.

Take ye therefore good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner of
similitude on the day \add that\add* the \nd LORD\nd* spake unto you in
Horeb out of the midst of the fire:

Lest ye corrupt \add yourselves\add*, and make you a graven
image, the similitude of any figure, the likeness of male or female,

The likeness of any beast that \add is\add* on the earth,
the likeness of any winged fowl that flieth in the air,

The likeness of any thing that creepeth on the ground, the
likeness of any fish that \add is\add* in the waters beneath the
earth:

And lest thou lift up thine eyes unto heaven, and when thou
seest the sun, and the moon, and the stars, \add even\add* all the
host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship them, and serve them, which the
\nd LORD\nd* thy God hath divided unto all nations under the whole
heaven.\f + \fr 4.19  \ft divided: or, imparted\f*

But the \nd LORD\nd* hath taken you, and brought you forth
out of the iron furnace, \add even\add* out of Egypt, to be unto him a
people of inheritance, as \add ye are\add* this day.

Furthermore the \nd LORD\nd* was angry with me for your sakes,
and sware that I should not go over Jordan, and that I should not
go in unto that good land, which the \nd LORD\nd* thy God giveth
 thee \add for\add* an inheritance:

But I must die in this land, I must not go over Jordan: but ye shall go
over, and possess that good land.

Take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the covenant of the
\nd LORD\nd* your God, which he made with you, and make you a graven
image, \add or\add* the likeness of any \add thing\add*, which the
\nd LORD\nd* thy God hath forbidden thee.

For the \nd LORD\nd* thy God \add is\add* a consuming fire,
\add even\add* a jealous God.

¶ When thou shalt beget children, and children’s children,
and ye shall have remained long in the land, and shall corrupt \add yourselves\add*,
and make a graven image, \add or\add* the likeness of any \add thing\add*,
and shall do evil in the sight of the \nd LORD\nd* thy God, to provoke him to
anger:

I call heaven and earth to witness against you this day, that ye shall
soon utterly perish from off the land whereunto ye go over Jordan
to possess it; ye shall not prolong \add your\add* days upon it, but shall
utterly be destroyed.

And the 
d LORD
d* shall scatter you among the nations,
and ye shall be left few in number among the heathen, whither the

d LORD
d* shall lead you.

And there ye shall serve gods, the work of men’s hands, wood
and stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

But if from thence thou shalt seek the \nd LORD\nd* thy God,
thou shalt find \add him\add*, if thou seek him with all thy heart
and with all thy soul.

When thou art in tribulation, and all these things are come upon thee,
\add even\add* in the latter days, if thou turn to the \nd LORD\nd*
thy God, and shalt be obedient unto his voice;\f + \fr 4.30  \ft are…: Heb. have found
thee\f*

(For the \nd LORD\nd* thy God \add is\add* a merciful God;)
he will not forsake thee, neither destroy thee, nor forget the covenant
of thy fathers which he sware unto them.

For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the
day that God created man upon the earth, and \add ask\add* from the one
side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been \add any such
thing\add* as this great thing \add is\add*, or hath been heard like it?

Did \add ever\add* people hear the voice of God speaking out
of the midst of the fire, as thou hast heard, and live?

Or hath God assayed to go \add and\add* take him a nation
from the midst of \add another\add* nation, by temptations, by signs,
and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty hand, and by a stretched
out arm, and by great terrors, according to all that the \nd LORD\nd*
your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?

Unto thee it was shewed, that thou mightest know that the
\nd LORD\nd* he \add is\add* God; \add there is\add* none else beside
him.

Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might
instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou
heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.

To drive out nations from before thee greater and mightier than thou
\add art\add*, to bring thee in, to give thee their land \add for\add*
an inheritance, as \add it is\add* this day.

Know therefore this day, and consider \add it\add* in thine
heart, that the \nd LORD\nd* he \add is\add* God in heaven above,
and upon the earth beneath: \add there is\add* none else.

Thou shalt keep therefore his statutes, and his commandments,
which I command thee this day, that it may go well with thee, and with thy
children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong \add thy\add* days
upon the earth, which the \nd LORD\nd* thy God giveth  thee, for ever.

¶ Then Moses severed three cities on this side Jordan toward the
sunrising;

That the slayer might flee thither, which should kill his
neighbour unawares, and hated him not in times past; and that fleeing
unto one of these cities he might live:

\add Namely\add*, Bezer in the wilderness, in the plain country,
of the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, of the Gadites; and Golan
in Bashan, of the Manassites.

¶ And this \add is\add* the law which Moses set before the
children of Israel:

These \add are\add* the testimonies, and the statutes, and the
judgments, which Moses spake unto the children of Israel, after they came
forth out of Egypt,

On this side Jordan, in the valley over against Beth-peor,
in the land of Sihon king of the Amorites, who dwelt at Heshbon,
whom Moses and the children of Israel smote, after they were come
forth out of Egypt:

From Aroer, which \add is\add* by the bank of the river Arnon,
even unto mount Sion, which \add is\add* Hermon,

And all the plain on this side Jordan eastward, even unto the
sea of the plain, under the springs of Pisgah.

And Moses called all Israel, and said unto them, Hear, O Israel,
the statutes and judgments which I speak in your ears this day, that ye may
learn them, and keep, and do them.\f + \fr 5.1  \ft keep…: Heb. keep to do
